data.author: Chris Christie

data.quote: I'm sure there were times when I wish I had thought, 'Gosh, that might really embarrass mom and dad,' but our parents didn't raise us to think about them. They're very selfless and they wanted us to have as normal of a college life as possible. So really, we didn't think of any repercussions.
data.author: Jenna Bush

data.quote: My mom and my dad wanted my brother and I to have a better life, you know, better education, better jobs. It was probably harder, much, much harder, for my parents. When you're a kid, you can learn a language much more easily; I learned English in less than a year.
data.author: Mila Kunis

data.quote: Being a mom makes me feel whole and like I understand the meaning of life.
data.author: Rebecca Romijn

data.quote: I love getting my nails done. My mom's best friend is a manicurist. When I was little, she'd do little paintings on my nails, like flowers.
data.author: Miranda Cosgrove

data.quote: My mom says: 'Why aren't you a doctor?' and I'm like, 'I am a doctor!' and she's all, 'No, I mean a real doctor.' She reads my books, but she says they give her a headache.
data.author: Brian Greene

data.quote: As a mom, you worry about protecting your kid. But there are extra added layers of fears when you're talking about a kid with autism or who has some special needs issue.
data.author: Holly Robinson Peete

data.quote: You need your mom and dad to protect you. It means they love you so much.
data.author: Gabby Douglas

data.quote: Work used to be the No. 1 important thing to me. Everything revolved around it, and to have a new perspective and have something else, my family, not just being a mom but being a part of an incredible family of my own, it makes me have a different perspective on life that I think is richer.
data.author: Lindsay Price

data.quote: I think 'Actions speak louder than words' is one thing, I think, I always took from my mom. And to this day, I think about that in everything I do.
data.author: Ginni Rometty

data.quote: Boxing is individual, although there's a team concept because you need a great corner, you need a great trainer, you need a great prep man, you need all of these things, but it's more of a Mano a Mano; it's more you versus me. I miss that time in training camp and Dad and Mom cooking meals. It was one big family.
data.author: Sugar Ray Leonard

data.quote: My mom broke the mold. She put my brother and I first, always, and worked her fingers to the bone trying to provide for us. She taught us right from wrong and gave us very strong morals and values and belief in family, things that have stayed with me.
data.author: Tim Howard

data.quote: When I eat, I have to chop up everything on the plate and stir it all together. It devastates my mom. Everyone at the table is like, 'That looks like cat vomit.' And I stir my Coke with a spoon until it's flat.
data.author: Margot Robbie

data.quote: I think the reason I'm a writer is because first, I was a reader. I loved to read. I read a lot of adventure stories and mystery books, and I have wonderful memories of my mom reading picture books aloud to me. I learned that words are powerful.
data.author: Andrew Clements

data.quote: My earliest memory is my mom picking me up after I had fallen down, giving me a big hug and reading me 'Goodnight Moon.' From that moment, to this one, every single memory I have of my mom is that regardless of what was happening in her life, she was always, always there for me.
data.author: Chelsea Clinton

data.quote: My mom got 11 kids. We struggled.
data.author: Young Thug

data.quote: My mom always taught me - you know, little boys listen to their moms too much - that whatever you put into something is what you're going to get out of it.
data.author: Jay-Z

data.quote: My jewelry's all fake - from Claire's. Or I get it from my mom's boutique in Barbados.
data.author: Rihanna

data.quote: Definitely there are lots of days that l am really tired, especially after becoming a new mom. There's nothing more exhausting because physically, mentally, emotionally, it requires you to be on all the time.
data.author: Jenna Dewan

data.quote: I did my first professional play at 11, and there was really nothing else I ever dreamed of doing. I felt so fortunate that I knew at the age of like, 12, like this is all I want to do for the rest of my life; that's the only play. There's no backup plan. My mom wanted me to go to school and have a backup plan. I'm like 'No, this is the only plan.'
data.author: Eric Johnson
